KitKat2::
She blushed and looked at the ring on her finger. "I...ah..I.." She 
stared at the ring.  She was so stunned that she could hardly 
breath. "It...it's....so...it's..ah..." 
She looked at Drillbit with sheer amazement on her face. This was the 
last thing she expected. 
"I don't know what to say."

DarkMouse::
She smiled. She had been listening in on the conversation from the 
security station.  She chuckled. "OH go on you big puppy dog. What's 
it going to hurt?"  She knew they couldn't hear her from the 
station.  She couldn't help but feel sorry for them. After all, a war 
doesn't leave much time for love. 
--- In nbwrpg@y..., RoboRick007 <rfa007@h...> wrote:
> ::DrillBit:;
> 
> He smiles.
> "Easy no, but its a good feeling. I like it. Plus whith the kind of 
bots
> we have its more like a family then a army."
> He remembered something he had gotton after the 'incident'.
> He opened a hatch in his arm, and pulled out a ring, and slipped it 
on
> her finger.
> "I believe this was yours, love."
